gurmukhi: lY jwNih rwGv qIr ] quih nYk dY kY cIr ]777]
transliteration: Lai Jaanb(i) Raaghav Teer|| Tuh(i) Naik Dai Kai Cheer||777||
translation: “I shall dress you and take you to (Raghava) Ram.”777.

gurmukhi: sunqy Bry iss mwn ] kr kop qwn kmwn ]
transliteration: Sounte Bhare Sis Maan|| Kar Kop Taan Kamaan||
translation: Hearing these words the boys were filled with pride and being enraged they pulled their bows;

gurmukhi: bhu BwNiq swiek Coir ] jn ABR swvx Er ]778]
transliteration: Bahu Bhaant(i) Saaik Chhodh(i)|| Jan Obhra Saavan Or||778||
translation: They discharged many arrows like the clouds of the month of Sawan.778.

gurmukhi: lwgy su swiek AMg ] igrgy su bwh auqMg ]
transliteration: Laage Su Saaik An|| Girge Su Baah Outan||
translation: Those, whom those arrows struck, fell down and overturned;

gurmukhi: khUM AMg BMg sbwh ] khUM caur cIr snwh ]779]
transliteration: Kahoon An Bhanh Sabaah|| Kahoon Chaur Cheer Sanaah||779||
translation: Somewhere those arrows chopped the limbs and somewhere they penetrated through the fly-whisk and armour.779.

gurmukhi: khUM ic`qR cwr kmwn ] khUM AMg joDn bwn ]
transliteration: Kuhoon Chittra Chaar Kamaan|| Kahoon An Jodhan Baan||
translation: Somewhere they created portraits on coming out of the beautiful bows and somewhere they pierced the limbs of the warriors;

gurmukhi: khUM AMg Gwie BB`k ] khUM sRox srq Cl`k ]780]
transliteration: Kahoon An Ghaae Bhabhakk|| Kahoon Sron Sarat Chhalakk||780||
translation: Somewhere the wound of the limbs burst open and somewhere the stream of blood overflowed.780.

gurmukhi: khUM BUq pRyq BkMq ] su khUM km`D auTMq ]
transliteration: Kahoon Bhoot Prêt Bhakant|| Su Kahoon Kamaddh Outhant||
translation: Somewhere the ghosts and fiends shouted and somewhere the headless trunks began to rise in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: khUM nwc bIr bYqwl ] so bmq fwkx juAwl ]781]
transliteration: Kahoon Naach Beer Baitaal|| So Bamat Daakan Juaal||781||
translation: Somewhere the brave Baitals danced and somewhere the Vampires raised flames of fire.781.

gurmukhi: rx Gwie Gwey vIr ] sB sRox BIgy cIr ]
transliteration: Ran Ghaae Ghaae Veer|| Sabh Sron Bheege Cheer||
translation: The garments of warriors were saturated with blood, on being wounded in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: iek bIr Bwj clMq ] iek Awn ju`D jutMq ]782]
transliteration: Ik Beer Bhaaj Chalant|| Ik Aan Juddh Joutant||782||
translation: On one side the warriors are running away and on the other side they are coming and fighting in the war.782.

gurmukhi: iek AYNc AYNc kmwn ] qk vIr mwrq bwn ]
transliteration: Ik Ainch Anch Kamaan|| Tak Veer Maarat Baan||
translation: On one side, the warriors are stretching their bows and discharging arrows;

gurmukhi: iek Bwj Bwj mrMq ] nhI surg qaun bsMq ]783]
transliteration: Ik Bhaaj Bhaaj Marant|| Nahisurag Taoun Basant||783||
translation: On the other side they are running away and brathing their last, but not getting a place in the heaven.783.

gurmukhi: gj rwj bwj Anyk ] ju`Jy n bwcw eyk ]
transliteration: Gad Raaj Baaj Anek|| Jujjhe Na Baachaa Ek||
translation: Many elephants and horses died and not even one was saved;
